introduction:
In this lesson, we will learn how to describe dishes and ingredients in simple English. We'll cover basic vocabulary related to food and dishes and learn simple sentence structures like:

  • This is... (to introduce a dish or ingredient)
  • It is... / They are... (to describe appearance, taste, etc.)
  • I like / I don’t like... (to express preferences)
presentation:
New Vocabulary:

  • This is bread. It is fresh.
  • I like rice with chicken.
  • Soup is hot.
  • Salad is made of vegetables.
  • The cake is sweet and delicious.
  • This dish is spicy.
  • I drink orange juice every morning.
conclusion:
In this lesson, we learned basic words to describe dishes and ingredients. We practiced using simple sentences like 'This is...' and 'I like...'.

Example Dialogue:

A: What do you like to eat?
B: I like rice with chicken. It is delicious.
A: Do you like salad?
B: Yes, I like salad. It is fresh.

Questions to Review:

  • What words can you use to describe food?
  • How do you say you like or don’t like something?
  • Can you describe a dish you like?

Homework: Write 5 sentences describing your favorite dish. Use words from this lesson. Example: “I like pizza. It is delicious.”
